title: The Difference Between a Comedian and a Comic
sub_head: Jerry Lewis said things funny. He was a comic.
body:
In “The Martin and Lewis Decade” (op-ed, July 26), Tevi Troy characterizes Jerry Lewis as “a rubber-faced, hyperkinetic Jewish comedian who seemed as if he couldn’t stand still for a moment.” But an old adage teaches that comedians are different from comics: Comedians say funny things, while comics say things funny. Lewis was definitely among the latter.
David E. Weisberg
Cary, N.C.
